snippet: The increase, reported in a new census by the Indian government, comes after a decade-long effort to mitigate poaching.
abstract: India says its tiger population has increased more than 30 percent over last four years to 2,226; rise comes after decade-long attempt to fight poaching; country has 70 percent of world's tigers.
lead_paragraph: The increase, reported in a new census by the Indian government, comes after a decade-long effort to mitigate poaching.

headline.main: India’s Rebounding Tiger Population Grows 30 Percent in 4 Years
headline.print_headline: India: Efforts Help Tiger Population Rise by 30 Percent
